intro: Triphasia sarmentosa, commonly known as the trailing triphasia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Simaroubaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which are followed by small, winged fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
